Award.AwardTitle: SCH: Student Travel Support for IEEE Conference on Connected Health (CHASE 2016)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
The proposal is for student travel support and participation in the IEEE Conference on Connected Health (CHASE 2016) in Washington, DC supportive scientific forum for students to engage in scholarship focusing on the multiple computing and engineering issues associated with the multidisciplinary field of connected health. The consortium provide a forum for expert and peer critique of students' doctoral work with the goal of improving their research. Student participants will also have the opportunity to receive networking support and career advice from internationally-recognized experts. Overall, the travel support brings together people who might not otherwise engage with one another and engage in multidisciplinary research in fields involving connected health. The CHASE conference also exposes participant to different scientific disciplinary approaches and develops the next generation of scholars in connected health.

This proposal for student travel support and participation in the IEEE Conference on Connected Health (CHASE 2016) in Washington, DC is to support doctoral students through constructive remarks and feedback on their interdisciplinary research from prominent researchers and through interaction with other students. Student participants explore a broad range of digital heath information technology, such as body sensor networks and intelligent techniques, while at the same time connecting patient and caregivers seamlessly in the loop of the healthcare ecosystem. Students will give short presentations of their work and receive constructive feedback from internationally respected experts in connected health. The experts will also provide student participants with career guidance and mentoring through presentations and small group advising throughout the day. In addition, student participants will have the opportunity to see the conference and network with conference attendees.

POR.DRECONTENT:
IEEE Conference on Connected Health: Applications, Systems, Engineering (CHASE) 2016 is a leading conference in the field of connected health. IEEE Conference on Connected Health: Applications, Systems, Engineering Technologies (CHASE). It aims at bringing together researchers worldwide working in the smart and connected health area to exchange innovative ideas and develop collaborations. The IEEE CHASE2016 conference has been held Washington D.C., on June 27-29, 2016. The conference offers an important venue for researchers in university and industrial research laboratories to meet and discuss openly the important issues in their research areas. IEEE CHASE 2016 brought together 100 or more professionals from academic and industrial backgrounds for discussing the development and application of state-of-the-art connected health.

The project support makes possible the participation of students who would otherwise be unable to attend. 23 students have received travel grants from the project and have attended the sessions of main conference, workshops, panel and demo/poster. The project allows these students to promote and get feedback on their work, exchange research experiences, and interact with established researchers. A large portion of these students have presented their research works in the form of paper oral presentations and/or posters/demos. CHASE Panel sessions allow students to learn about different industrial/academic career opportunities and future technology trends. The support provides students who attend with the opportunities to interact with mentors and peers of varying gender, ethnicity and background. It brings student researcher together with experts in the smart and connected health area to exchange innovation ideas and develop collaborations.  The project helps educate young professionals in the area of smart and connected health.


Last Modified: 04/05/2017
Modified by: Honggang Wang
